GMRF package¶

Submodules¶

GMRF.GMRF module¶

This helper solves all the essential problems associated with GMRF class.

class GMRF.GMRF.GMRF¶

Bases: object

assimilate_data(dataset: ndarray) → tuple¶

Assimilate dataset to spde kernel. It computes the distance matrix between gmrf grid and dataset grid. Then the values are averged to each cell. :param dataset: np.array([x, y, z, sal])

construct_gmrf_grid() → None¶

Construct GMRF grid by converting lats, lons to xy.

get_eibv_at_locations(loc: ndarray) → ndarray¶

Get EIBV at candidate locations.

Parameters:

loc – np.array([[x1, y1, z1], [x2, y2, z2], … [xn, yn, zn]])

Returns:

EIBV associated with each location.

get_gmrf_grid() → ndarray¶

Returns: gmrf_grid (private variable)

static get_ibv(threshold: float, mu: ndarray, sigma_diag: ndarray) → ndarray¶

Calculate the integrated bernoulli variance given mean and variance.

get_ind_from_location(loc: ndarray) → Optional[Union[int, ndarray]]¶
Parameters:

loc – np.array([xp, yp, zp])

Returns: index of the closest waypoint.

get_location_from_ind(ind: Union[int, list]) → ndarray¶

Get that location given its index in the gmrf grid. :param ind: int or list of int specify where the locations are in gmrf grid.

Returns: numpy array containing locations np.array([[x1, y1, z1],

[x2, y2, z2], … [xn, yn, zn]])

get_mu()¶

Returns: conditional mean of the GMRF field.

get_mvar()¶

Returns: conditional mariginal variance of the GMRF field.

get_rotated_angle()¶

Returns: rotated angle of the gmrf grid.

GMRF.spde module¶

class GMRF.spde.spde¶

Bases: object

candidate(ks, n=250)¶

Returns the marginal variance of all location given that a location (ks) in the GMRF has been measured. Uses Monte Carlo samples to calculate the marginal variance for all locations.

Parameters:

  • ks (integer) – Array of indicies of possible candidate locations

  • n (int, optional) – Number of samples used in the Monte Carlo estimate. Defaults to 40.

cholesky(Q)¶

A function calculating the cholesky decoposition of a positive definite precision matrix of the GMRF. Uses the c++ package Cholmod

Parameters:

Q ([N,N] sparse csc matrix) – Sparse matrix from scipy.sparse

mvar(Q_fac=None, n=250)¶

Monte Carlo Estimate of the marginal variance of a GMRF.

Parameters:

  • Q_fac (Cholmod object, optional) – Cholmod cholesky object. Defaults to None.

  • n (int, optional) – Number of samples used in the Monte Varlo estimate. Defaults to 40.

sample(n=1)¶

Samples the GMRF. Only used to test.

Parameters:

n (int, optional) – Number of realizations. Defaults to 1.

setThreshold()¶

Set threshold for Excursion set

update(rel, ks)¶

Update mean and precision of the GMRF given some measurements in the field.

Parameters:

  • rel ([k,1]-array) – k number of measurements of the GMRF. (k>0).

  • ks ([k,]-array) – k number of indicies describing the index of the measurment in the field.
